```{r include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(volker)
theme_set(theme_bw())

data <- volker::chatgpt

# Recode -9 to NA
data <- prepare(data)

```

## Frequencies of categorical variables

### 1. One variable: Frequency plot of Gender
```{r}
plot_counts_one(data, sd_geschlecht)
```

### 2. Multiple items: Frequency plot for adoption factors
```{r}
plot_counts_items(data, starts_with("cg_adoption_"), numbers = "p")
```

### 3. Two variables: Stacked frequency plot of innovator type by gender

```{r}
plot_counts_one_grouped(data, in_adoption, sd_geschlecht, prop = "rows")
plot_counts_one_grouped(data, in_adoption, sd_geschlecht, prop = "cols")
```

## Metric distributions

### 1. Distribution for one metric variable: Age
```{r}
plot_metrics_one(data, sd_alter)
```


### 2. Distribution of multiple metric items: Adoption factors
```{r}
plot_metrics_items(data, starts_with("cg_adoption_"))
```

### 3. Distribution by a grouping variable
```{r}
plot_metrics_one_grouped(data, sd_alter, sd_geschlecht)
plot_metrics_items_grouped(data, starts_with("cg_adoption_"), sd_geschlecht)
```

### 4. Index  distribution by a grouping variable
```{r}

data %>%
  add_idx(starts_with("cg_adoption_social_")) %>%
  add_idx(starts_with("cg_adoption_fearofuse_")) %>%
  add_idx(starts_with("cg_adoption_advantage_")) %>%
  
  # Set new labels for the three index columns
  labs_apply(tribble(
    ~item_name, ~item_label,
    "idx_cg_adoption_social", "ChatGPT-Erwartung: Social",
    "idx_cg_adoption_fearofuse", "ChatGPT-Erwartung: Fear of Use",
    "idx_cg_adoption_advantage", "ChatGPT-Erwartung: Advantage"
  )) %>%
  
  plot_metrics_items_grouped(starts_with("idx_cg_adoption"), in_adoption)
  
```
